From half-equation Cu2+ + 2e- -> Cu, 2 moles of electrons deposit 1 mole of copper. Calculate moles of Cu: n(Cu) = n(e-) / 2 = 0.02798 / 2 = 0.01399 mol. Calculate mass of copper deposited: mass = n × Mr where Mr(Cu) = 63.55 g mol-1 from line 24. mass(Cu) = 0.01399 mol × 63.55 g mol-1 = 0.889 g.
